title: Katheryn Winnick wraps up new Liam Neeson film ahead of Vikings final
text:
Katheryn Winnick wraps up new film with ‘wonderful’ Liam Neeson (Pictures: Instagram/REX)

Katheryn Winnick has officially wrapped up her new film, The Minutemen, which she will star in alongside Liam Neeson.

The 41-year-old will join the likes of Narcos’ Juan Pablo Raba in the upcoming action thriller, and it sounds as though they’ve had a blast filming the project.

Taking to Instagram, the Vikings actress shared a picture of herself posing alongside Liam as she gushed over him in the caption.

She wrote: ‘That’s a wrap! Thank you Liam Neeson for being such a generous, giving actor and a wonderful friend. #MinuteMan #comingsoon.’

Fans were quick to comment and were full of praise for their warrior queen.

They’ll be starring in The Minutemen (Picture: @katherynwinnick)

‘You are an incredible woman an inspirational person keep doing what you are doing… I love Vikings,’ one wrote while another added: ‘The two best actors you’ll find today.’

Advertisement

Advertisement

Someone else was in agreement as they said: ‘Two legends in one picture.’

And let’s face it, they’re not wrong!

Katheryn’s picture comes days after the release date was announced for the sixth and final episode of Vikings.

To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser that supports HTML5 video

Katheryn recently teased what’s to come for her character in Vikings (Picture: Getty Images)

Getting fans hyped for the upcoming episodes, the star shared the news of the latest trailer on her Instagram where she urged her followers to watch it.

‘Smiling because @historyvikings returns for its final season on Dec 4,’ the Lagertha star wrote: ‘Be sure to check out the trailer for the epic new season on their Facebook page. #vikings.’

While not much is known about the character’s storyline, the actress has hinted at one last battle for the much-loved shieldmaiden.

Chatting to ET Canada the 41-year-old joked that her character is now a granny, as she revealed: ‘It’s going to be adventurous, it’s going to be amazing.

Advertisement

Advertisement

‘I’ll tell you one thing though, she is definitely not done fighting yet. There is still one big battle left to come.’

Vikings season six is expected to drop onto the History Channel and Amazon Prime on 4 December.

description: Katheryn Winnick wraps up new film with 'wonderful' Liam Neeson ahead of Vikings final.
